Posts.Content: Jollymom wrote: God I have struggled about posting this with all the heartbreaking news coming from here.  The lovely ladies that we have come to know and love losing their battles with this horrible disease.  I come here everyday.  I read post after post everyday but I hardly ever post a comment because I can't from my phone for some reason.  So I read and cry each and everyday with all of you. I awhile back I became NED thru the PARP inhibitor trial at MDA. I have remained NED since.  I'm still on the protocol because BiPar has yet to make any changes to the trial for people in my situation, and from what I understand there are ALOT of people out there who are in my situation and are frustrated.  The protocol is so rigorous. I literally live at MDA.  I had to demand some time to regroup for my family.  MDA wrote a great article about me this past week.  Of course they didn't put in that I had become NED, I wasn't ok with that.  But that being said it has been posted and there is a link also at the bottom for the interview with the head of the PARP trial at MDA. I hope that this brings hope to some of you.  Theres no telling how long I'll stay NED. I pray and I hope everyday that this continues for many years to come, that I'll be able to watch my 7and 4 year olds grow up and become men. I post this with great sadness in my heart but with great hope for the future. Click here for the article Cheryl NOW NED Dx Nov 06 stg IIA DCIS no lymph FAC/Taxol/RAD Feb09 stge IV met to lung-removed Xempra x6,Aug 09 met to Liver (9)and Lymph in chest & 3 in Kidneys. Xeloda/Avastin failed--Now in PARP trial.Triple Negative Dx 8/2009, DCIS, 4cm, Stage IV, 0/21 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Md Anderson Article Jollymom angelsabove

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2010 03:36PM Jollymom wrote: Thanks ladies! @ Leanneh I wasnt ever put into a lottery.  MDA had the parp trial and I met the specifics to join the trial.  I do so hope your able to get into it.
Posts.Title: Md Anderson Article Jollymom angelsabove

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2010 05:12PM Jollymom wrote: I had shaved it the first time after my second round of FAC.  It was coming out in handfuls.  It was prob one of the hardest things Ive ever done.  Wouldn't and couldn't look in the mirror with out a scarf on for days.  Then the second time I just cut it into a short pixie cut and waited for it to all fall out, it didn't.  It got really thin tho, could see my scalp.  I'm waiting for the show to fall now, Ive been in treatment with carbo/gem/parp for 6 weeks and I'm waiting. I'm vain. I admit it. LOL But heck if you have the wigs go for it!
Posts.Title: Shaving my head today lorrhaw dreamwriter

Posts.Content: Jollymom wrote: Ladies after 5 months of Gem/Carbo/PARP two weeks-twice a week-one week off, I am now NED!!!  OMG  I went from thinking the very worst to this. Its huge.  I just found out that I org had 9 tumors in my liver, the largest was 4.3cm, and I had 3 on my kidneys, the largest there was 2.9cm.  The only thing left is some scar tissue on my left kidney.  I'm still in shock.  They bad thing is that they have nothing in place for this occurance as of yet because its still in trial phase, so BiPar was just sent all the data from all the trials around the nation and they are suppose to be making an amendment to the trial for these sort of things.  I dont want to be on this until I become toxic and then we wont have this in our arsenal any longer.  So as of now I'm still going to be chugging along until they say hey lets take a break, because if I demand a break and it comes back then whos to say I'll get back on the PARP until its FDA approved.  I was just asked by my research nurse that MDA wants me to do a piece for a cancer publication.  How exciting. Its possible ladies, it is possible. Hopefully I'll stay ned for a long while.  I have two little boys who need their mommy by golly.  Must keep going! Cheryl NOW NED Dx Nov 06 stg IIA DCIS no lymph FAC/Taxol/RAD Feb09 stge IV met to lung-removed Xempra x6,Aug 09 met to Liver (9)and Lymph in chest & 3 in Kidneys. Xeloda/Avastin failed--Now in PARP trial.Triple Negative Dx 8/2009, DCIS, 4cm, Stage IV, 0/21 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Nov 2, 2009 09:21PM Jollymom wrote: I have a scans next week too.  Pet/CT.  Every ache,every muscle that hurts here or there freaks me out.  As I type this my back hurts, oh and under my right arm where there took the lymphnodes.  Its so freaken scarey!!  I'd say I'm scared shitless but thats just the Xeloda. Praying that the liver lesions have shrank as well as the one lymphnode.  I  HAVE TO HAVE GOOD NEWS!!!!! I wish you the best with your scans next week.  You have an awesome nurse!  Sometimes they make all the difference in the world. I love mine!
Posts.Title: Why is it.... DianaT lukejessesmom

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2010 09:54PM Jollymom wrote: Ive been home since 2006, and there have been days, weeks, and months when I'm just aching to get back in the rat race, then I look at my sons face when he gets off the bus and sees me, then know that I made the right decision.  Hes doing so much better in school since Ive been home.  It may seem like a void has been left in your life for a bit, but the kids will fill that!  I do alot of volunteering up at the school now, keeps me plenty busy when I WANT it, on MY time, not someone elses. Good Luck!!
Posts.Title: Well, I finally made my announcement at work... Fitztwins ShirleyHughes

Posts.Content: Oct 25, 2009 09:25PM Jollymom wrote: Kirby, I'm a newbie here, but I'm currently on Xeloda 2x a day 2 weeks on and 1 off, and Avastin every 3 weeks.  I'm right outside of Houston!  Do you go to MD Anderson?  I am on my 3rd round of it.  I'm due to have a pet/ct scan in 2 1/2 weeks to see if its helping at all.  I originally dx in Nov of 06 with stage 2 DCIS with no lymph involvement.  Had lumpectomy, FAC for 6 rounds and then Taxol for 6 weeks followed by 6 weeks of radiation. Was disease free until Jan of this year and we found a single tumor in my right lung.  They removed it and I did 6 rounds of Xempra.  A month later I had a pet scan done and they found the mets to my liver (2) and in a lymph in my chest.  So now I'm now on Xeloda and Avastin.  I had some problems with the bottom of my feet hurting so badly that I couldn't walk during the 2nd round but nothing else.  My onc took me off for 3 days and its amazing what it does for your feet with only a few days of being off of it.  Blew my mind how quickly it happened. I was originally on 3500 a day but she dropped it to 3000mg when the feet problem arose.  I do use Aquaphor religiously on my feet and hands tho to ward off the possibility of my hands cracking and peeling. Otherwise I'm just tired but my QOL is great! I'm 36 and have 2 little boys 6 and 3 that keep me going nonstop.  I am triple neg tho, so hopefully if this isn't working I'm suppose to be in the PARP trial.  But I'm hoping that this is working!  Good luck!
Posts.Title: Success Stories for Xeloda and Avistan kirby Jollymom
